owl:Ontology.dc:creator: María Poveda-Villalón (Ontology Engineering Group, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
Serge Chávez-Feria (Ontology Engineering Group, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The material properties ontology provides the vocabulary to describe physical properties related to components, materials and layer in a building context.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Material properties ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a building element and its construction. This construction can be a layer set, a profile set, or a constituent set. For example, a window has two construction individuals: The Lining and the Glazing.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has construction

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a construction component (Layer, profile, constituent) and the materials that define them.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has material

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between a constituent set and the specific material constituents.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has material constituent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between a layer set and the specific material layers.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has material layer

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between a profile set and the specific material profiles.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has material profile

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a feature of interest and a measurement about it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has measurement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship identifying the unit of measure used for a certain entity.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is measured in

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a material's property with the database where it is defined.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is property from database

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a property value with the database where it comes from.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is property value from database

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property indicates a commonly-used unit.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: commonly has unit

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a feature of interest and a property of that feature.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has property

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a property and the measurements it relates to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: relates to measurement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a measurement and the property it relates to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: relates to property

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship defining the value of a certain property, e.g., energy or power. Note that, even if numeric values are expected to enable reasoning, measurement values could use other datatypes.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has value

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The building element comprises all elements that are primarily part of the construction of a building, i.e., its structural and space separating system. Building elements are all physically existent and tangible things.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Building Element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The door is a building element that is predominately used to provide controlled access for people and goods. It includes constructions with hinged, pivoted, sliding, and additionally revolving and folding operations. A door consists of a lining and one or several panels.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Door

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A duct segment is used to typically join two sections of duct network.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Duct Segment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An element is a generalization of all components that make up an AEC product.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Defines the occurrence of a segment of a flow distribution system.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Flow Segment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A pipe segment is used to typically join two sections of a piping network.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pipe Segment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A roof is the covering of the top part of a building, it protects the building against the effects of wheather.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Roof

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A slab is a component of the construction that normally encloses a space vertically. The slab may provide the lower support (floor) or upper construction (roof slab) in any space in a building.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Slab

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The wall represents a vertical construction that bounds or subdivides spaces. Wall are usually vertical, or nearly vertical, planar elements, often designed to bear structural loads. A wall is however not required to be load bearing.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Wall

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The window is a building element that is predominately used to provide natural light and fresh air. It includes vertical opening but also horizontal opening such as skylights or light domes. It includes constructions with swinging, pivoting, sliding, or revolving panels and fixed panels. A window consists of a lining and one or several panels.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Window
Concrete with expanded clay or brick chippings aggregate
Insulating materials from renewable raw material

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A homogeneous or inhomogeneous substance that can be used to form elements (physical products or their components). (Definition taken from IFC)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A single and identifiable part of an element which is constructed of a number of part (one or more) each having an individual material.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material constituent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A collection of individual material constituents, each assigning a material to a part of an element.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material constituent set

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the set of available databases for building materials.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material database

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A single and identifiable part of an element which is constructed of a number of layers (one or more).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material layer

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A designation by which materials of an element constructed of a number of material layers is known and through which the relative positioning of individual layers can be expressed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material layer set

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A single and identifiable cross section of an element which is constructed of a number of profiles (one or more).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material profile

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A designation by which individual material(s) of a prismatic element (for example, beam or column) constructed of a single or multiple material profiles is known.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material profile set

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Properties that describe building materials.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material property

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The measurement, value and unit of measure, related to properties of building materials.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material property measurement
Reinforced concrete / normal concrete with reinforcement
Underlays and back coatings of floor covering.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A feature of interest represents any real world entity from which a property is measured. (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Feature of interest

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement. (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Measurement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A quality of a feature of interest that can be measured; an aspect of a feature of interest that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the feature. (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Property

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended, also using some other ontologies rather than the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). (Definition taken from SAREF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Unit of measure

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A boiler is a closed, pressure-rated vessel in which water or other fluid is heated using an energy source such as natural gas, heating oil, or electricity. The fluid in the vessel is then circulated out of the boiler for use in various processes or heating applications.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Boiler

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A generalization of all elements that participate in a distribution system.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Distribution Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Defines occurrence elements of a distribution system that facilitate the distribution of energy or matter, such as air, water or power.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Distribution Flow Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Defines the occurrence of a device used to perform energy conversion or heat transfer and typically participates in a flow distribution system.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Energy Conversion Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A fan is a device which imparts mechanical work on a gas. A typical usage of a fan is to induce airflow in a building services air distribution system.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Fan

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Defines the occurrence of elements of a distribution system that are used to regulate flow through a distribution system. Examples include dampers, valves, switches, and relays.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Flow Controller

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Defines the occurrence of an apparatus used to distribute, circulate or perform conveyance of fluids, including liquids and gases (such as a pump or fan), and typically participates in a flow distribution system.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Flow Moving Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Defines the occurrence of a device that participates in a distribution system and is used for temporary storage (such as a tank).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Flow Storage Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Defines the occurrence of a permanently attached element that acts as a terminus or beginning of a distribution system (such as an air outlet, drain, water closet, or sink). A terminal is typically a point at which a system interfaces with an external environment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Flow Terminal

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A heat exchanger is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media such as plate and shell and tube heat exchangers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Heat Exchanger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An outlet is a device installed at a point to receive one or more inserted plugs for electrical power or communications.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Outlet

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A pump is a device which imparts mechanical work on fluids or slurries to move them through a channel or pipeline. A typical use of a pump is to circulate chilled water or heating hot water in a building services distribution system.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pump

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A solar device converts solar radiation into other energy such as electric current or thermal energy.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Solar Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Space heaters utilize a combination of radiation and/or natural convection using a heating source such as electricity, steam or hot water to heat a limited space or area. Examples of space heaters include radiators, convectors, baseboard and finned-tube heaters.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Space Heater

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A switch is used in a cable distribution system (electrical circuit) to control or modulate the flow of electricity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Switching Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A tank is a vessel or container in which a fluid or gas is stored for later use.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Tank

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A tube bundle is a device consisting of tubes and bundles of tubes used for heat transfer and contained typically within other energy conversion devices, such as a chiller or coil.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Tube Bundle

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The ASHRAE 2005 Handbook of Fundamentals, Chapter 25 contains thermal property data (e.g., conductivity, density, specific heat) of selected building materials. The data is provided for reference materials and not concrete building products. The materials dataset is also provided as part of the EnergyPlus software.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Abiotic depletion potential for fossil resources (ADPF)
Abiotic depletion potential for non fossil resources (ADPE)
Acidification potential of soil and water (AP)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A database of building material and their ecological and structural-physical aspects. Currently 3616 building products from 359 vendors are described in the database. The baubook platform also contains a catalog with around 400 reference values which includes different ecological and structural-physical indicators. These values deliver the primary indicators and orientation values for energy and eco certificates. They are especially helpful for calculating energy certificates in early planning phase where the concrete products are not decided yet.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Backside solar reflectance at normal incidence (BSSRNI)
Backside visible reflectance at normal incidence (BSVRNI)
Depletion potential of the stratospheric layer (ODP)
Frontside visible reflectance at normal incidence (FSVRNI)

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A database that provides around 1200 life cycle assessment datasets regarding building materials, construction, transport, energy and disposal processes. The database can be used to reconstruct the entire building life cycle and is maintained by the German Ministry of Interior, Building and Community. The used data format is based on the ILCD data format, compliant to EN 15804 and provided as CSV files.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Total use of non renewable primary energy resource (PENRT)
Total use of renewable primary energy (PERT)
Use of non renewable primary energy (PENRE)
Use of non renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PENRM)
Use of non renewable secondary fuels (NRSF)
Use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials (PERM)
Window glass spectral data set name (WGSDSN)
